comments:
How I did it:

With sleak and graphics-trace on:

Open Resource perspective; open sleak view; close all perspectives but resource
perspective; close all views but sleak view.

Close Eclipse.

Open Eclipse again.

Open Window/Preferences. Close Preferences. Reopen and close again. => loads
Dialog fonts and all fonts on the first preference page.

Take a snapshot in sleak view.

We start w/ 52 colors, 2 cursors, 5 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images

For each pref page: open preferences select page in tree, close preference
dialog, reopen preference, close preference, note new resources.

Install/Update: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 7 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+2 fonts]
Automatic Updats: 52 colors, 2 cursors, 8 fonts, 1 GC, 87 images [+1 font]

3 fonts are leaked -- both pref pages should only use the Dialog Font.

I've set all shared fonts (Workbench/Fonts) to different font types so I can
easily tell which font has been loaded.

Both preference pages will allocate the system default font (on my system: MS
Sans Serif 8) -- which they should not.

Traces for the images:

@@Install/Update @@
